title: Tammy Peterson: Order from Chaos, Learning to See Again
description:
This is a brief clip from my new conversation with Tammy Peterson in which she talks about the importance of truly seeing.

The full video can be viewed here:  https://youtu.be/16w3olAM9tc

https://karenwongart.com
https://TheMeaningCode.com
The Meaning Code Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgp_r6WlBwDSJrP43Mz07GQ/videos

transcript_parts.text: but i think i was saying to you that i
had just started doing watercolors and
uh i'm taking uh on they're all online
zoom courses of course but that makes
means i can take a course in vancouver
and i'm in toronto so it's wonderful
so um they are teaching me to put down
to take a very brush full of paint
and then just slop it on the surface
just slop it on the surface flush it
make the surface wet
then push it push the paint around let
it run and everything
let it dry and then look at it
it's a landscape where are the trees
where's the
where's the water where's the buildings
and and you can make uh and everybody in
the class was not everybody but some
people were very frustrated with it
because
because you are really making an image
like you are
making an image out of your chaotic
background
you're i was like we were making images
out of our
chaotic background and it takes time
and patience right and so if people are
used to being able to get things done
to put it on paper to get to the next
project that's not
going to work with this and i mean after
you've done it for a very long time and
you're used to it
you start to see the images faster you
start to see what's
appropriate for this or that in a in a
clearer way because you've got
so much context now but at the beginning
when you're doing it
you're fresh and you have to learn
to see really for the first time again
and wow what a great
project to be able to learn to see again
you know i'm 60 years old and i start i
started to learn to see again
wow
